ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class WaggleNavigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.Navigation
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.WaggleNavigation
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ReLocalizeNavigation

    public class WaggleNavigation
extends Navigation
    A navigator that actively corrects its heading and position. Named as such t=due to waggling as it corrects its heading and position.
    Author:
    Matthew

        void waggle(WaggleNavigation.Axis a,

        d - is the direction that the robot is facing

      • waggle

        public void waggle(int direction,
                   int side)
        moves forwards until a line is detected, then uses the difference in location to detecting the the same line with the other sensor to correct the angle, it also corrects its position.
        Parameters:
        direction - 0 for x, 1 for y
        side - 1 for positive, -1 for negative

      • waggle

        private void waggle(int direction,
                    int side,
                    LineDetectorController detectorL,
                    LineDetectorController detectorR)
        moves forwards until a line is detected, then uses the difference in location to detecting the the same line with the other sensor to correct the angle, it also corrects its position.
        Parameters:
        direction - 0 for x, 1 for y
        side - 1 for positive, -1 for negative
        detectorL - left line detector
        detectorR - right line detector

      • tooFar

        private static boolean tooFar(double[] startPos)
        returns true if its been too far since the last line detected for it to be the same line.
        Parameters:
        startPos - is a given starting location.
        Returns:
        if it has traveled too far for it to be the same line.
